newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS - St George sees up to 1,000 job losses.
newsitem.headline: RTRS - St George sees up to 1,000 job losses.

text.p: St George Bank Ltd said on Monday that a combined St George-Advance Bank group would possibly lay off up to 1,000 workers in the two years after the merger.
"Quite possibly we'd see up to 1,000 going overall," St George managing director Jim Sweeney told a news conference when asked how many workers would be made redundant after the merger.
St George announced earlier on Monday that it and Advance Bank Ltd had agreed to an A$2.65 billion merger.
St George said with the merger announcement that it expected the merger would yield A$140 million in cost savings or about 15 percent of the cost base.
It also said the bank would incur restructuring costs of A$50 million in the year after the merger.
Sweeney said there were 167 branches where the banks overlapped and they were candidates for removal.
He also said the bank had been in discussion with bank unions about the redundancies and was confident the redundancies could be handled with a minimum of disruption.

Earlier, St George announced it would bid an effective A$7.30 per share for Advance, including A$2.10 in cash, a 20 cent special cash dividend and new St George shares up to a value of A$5.00 per Advance Bank share.
The merger plan values Advance at A$2.65 billion.
